message.content:
cs.NE, cs.ET, cs.AR, cs.AI, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses the implementation of deep neural networks onto neuromorphic chips with crossbar arrays of synapses, which falls under the category of neuromorphic computing. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of dedicated hardware for neuromorphic computing, which falls under cs.ET (Emerging Technologies). The paper also discusses the use of algorithms specific or compatible to neuromorphic hardware, which falls under cs.AR (Hardware Architecture). The paper also discusses the use of a Python wrapper that can be integrated with almost every simulator tool for neuromorphic chips, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the paper discusses the implementation of a classification task on MNIST and CIFAR-10 datasets, which falls under cs.SY (Systems and Control).
